title: General Knowledge Quiz II (50 Questions)
description: Challenging but fair across pop culture, history, science, geography, and tech. No sports content.

items.q: Which film features the line “Here’s looking at you, kid”?
In The Lord of the Rings, what is the Elvish name for Rivendell?
Who wrote the novel Nineteen Eighty-Four?
Which director is nicknamed the “Master of Suspense”?
Which TV series features the character Walter White?
Which video game series tasks the hero with defeating Ganon?
Who composed The Four Seasons?
Which artist created the pop‑art work Campbell’s Soup Cans?
Which author created the detective Sherlock Holmes?
In Star Wars, what is the name of Han Solo’s ship?
Which ancient civilization built Machu Picchu?
Who was the first Emperor of Rome?
In which year did the Berlin Wall fall?
Who was known as the “Maid of Orléans”?
What was the name of the ship that carried the Pilgrims to North America in 1620?
Which war ended with the Treaty of Versailles?
Who became South Africa’s first Black president in 1994?
Which ancient civilization is credited with inventing cuneiform writing?
Who was the longest‑reigning British monarch?
Which revolution began in 1789?
Which planet has the Great Red Spot?
What is the chemical symbol for gold?
What force keeps planets in orbit around the Sun?
Which gas do plants absorb from the atmosphere for photosynthesis?
Which part of the human eye controls the amount of light entering?
What is the most abundant metal in Earth’s crust?
What is the freezing point of water in Fahrenheit?
What is the largest internal organ in the human body?
What is the process by which plants lose water through their leaves called?
What is the nearest star to Earth after the Sun?
What is the capital of Australia?
Which country is home to the ancient city of Petra?
What is the largest hot desert in the world?
Which city is famous for its canals and gondolas?
What is the smallest country in the world by area?
In which country is Mount Kilimanjaro located?
What is the official language of Brazil?
Which Asian country was formerly known as Siam?
The Grand Canyon is in which U.S. state?
Which ocean lies along the east coast of the United States?
What does CPU stand for?
What was the name of the IBM computer that beat Garry Kasparov in 1997?
What does USB stand for?
Who acquired Android Inc. in 2005?
In printing, what does DPI stand for?
In computing, what does AI stand for?
What is the common keyboard shortcut for Undo on Windows?
Who is credited with inventing the World Wide Web?
What is the term for malicious software that demands payment?
What does SSD stand for?
